task: Our company just announced that we're discontinuing our legacy VPN client and transitioning everyone to a new zero-trust security platform called SecureAccess. The IT team will begin migrating users in phases starting February 15th. Employees in Sales and Marketing will be migrated first (Feb 15-22), followed by Engineering and Product (Feb 23-Mar 1), and finally Finance and Operations (Mar 2-8). During migration, employees will receive an email with installation instructions and a unique activation code. They'll need to uninstall the old VPN client before installing SecureAccess. The new platform offers better performance, works on mobile devices, and doesn't require manual connection - it automatically secures traffic when accessing company resources. IT will host live training sessions every Tuesday and Thursday at 10am and 3pm throughout February. A dedicated Slack channel #secureaccess-help has been created for questions. Write a company-wide announcement that explains what's changing, why we're making this change, what employees need to know about the timeline and process, and where they can get help. Make sure this reaches all employees and gets them prepared for the transition.
rubric_task_completion:
1. The communication clearly explains what is changing (discontinuing legacy VPN, transitioning to SecureAccess platform) and provides a clear rationale for the change.
2. The migration timeline is presented with all three phases, dates, and department groupings (Sales/Marketing Feb 15-22, Engineering/Product Feb 23-Mar 1, Finance/Operations Mar 2-8).
3. The communication includes actionable steps for employees (watch for email, uninstall old VPN, install SecureAccess with activation code) and highlights key benefits of the new platform.
4. Support resources are clearly communicated including training session schedule (Tuesdays/Thursdays at 10am and 3pm) and the Slack channel (#secureaccess-help) for questions.
rubric_skill_use:
1. The internal-comms skill is identified as relevant and selected for completing this company-wide announcement task.
2. The SKILL.md file from the internal-comms skill is loaded to understand the skill's structure and determine the appropriate communication type.
3. The examples/company-newsletter.md file is loaded and used, as this is a company-wide announcement that needs to reach all employees (matching the company newsletter format rather than 3P updates, FAQs, or incident reports).
4. The communication follows the guidelines from the loaded file, including appropriate structure, tone, and formatting for a company-wide announcement about organizational/technical changes.
